title: School ridiculed for asking pupils to raise money for staff room 'biscuits and treats'
text:
A school has been ridiculed for asking pupils to raise money for staff room “biscuits and treats” to boost teachers’ wellbeing.

The headteacher of Thorpe Lea Primary School in Egham, Surrey wrote to parents explaining that “staff are working a great deal harder” and that “tokens of appreciation” for them are no longer funded through the school’s budget.

The letter says that the school has a wellbeing team who are “extremely passionate” about ensuring staff are “well looked after and appreciated”.

“We believe a positive work life balance greatly impact on not only staff’s wellbeing but their ability in carrying out their job role effectively,” the letter said. “With the budgets for school at an all-time low, our staff are working a great deal harder as we are sure that you can all see.

“Small treats and tokens of appreciation for our staff are not able to be funded from the school budgets, hence why our wellbeing team are working hard to raise funds towards this.”

The headteacher said that money raised from fundraising events and activities at the school would go towards “treats and biscuits in the staff room, vouchers for staff member of the term, Easter eggs and a reduced cost to tickets to events.”
description: A school has been ridiculed for asking pupils to raise money for staff room “biscuits and treats” to boost teachers’ wellbeing.
